questions.question: Decrease in volume of soil mass due to expulsion of air voids is known as __________.

explanations.a: Decrease of volume of soil mass due to the expulsion of water voids due to the gradual increase in static load is called consolidation.
explanations.b: The volume change which occurs due to the change in moisture content is termed as shrinkage.
explanations.c: Decrease in volume of soil mass due to the expulsion of air voids is termed as compression
explanations.d: It is the property of sand to increase in volume due to addition of moisture content. The increased total volume of moist fine aggregate over the same dry mass.

questions.question: The consolidation of a soil mass can also be schematically explained using the ______________ .

explanations.a: The consolidation can also be explained using the spring analogy where spring represents the soil structure and water in the container represents pore water in the soil.
explanations.b: Soil phase diagram is representation of different phases separated in soil.
explanations.c: Soil particle distribution is the separation of soil particles according to the size of the soil.
explanations.d: The correct answer is provided in the above option.

explanations.a: The rate of escape of pore water depends on soil type and its property.
explanations.b: Permeability is the ability of water to pass through the pores present in the soil, Hence rate of escape of pore water is directly proportional to permeability.
explanations.c: Rate of escape of pore water also depends on the physical condition of soil.
explanations.d: The rate of escape of pore water is directly proportional to all the above provided options i.e type of soil, Permeability, Physical condition.

difficulty.question: Which of the following instrument is not required to conduct the consolidation test?

explanations.a: Pressure pads with steel balls  are placed on the top of porous stone which is used to exert pressure on it.
explanations.b: Filter paper is a layer used between soil specimen and porous stone to avoid entry of soil particles to pores of stone.
explanations.c: Porous stone is placed above and below the soil specimen  to represent the previous soil layer in the field.
explanations.d: Steel scale is used to measure the dimensions, where no measurement is required in this experiment.

difficulty.question: The apparatus used for the conduction of this experiment is __________ .

explanations.a: Triaxial testing machine is used to determine the shear strength of the soil.
explanations.b: Consoildometer is the apparatus used in the consolidation test experiment.
explanations.c: A Permeameter is an apparatus used to determine permeability of soil.
explanations.d: Correct answer is provided in the above option.
